title: Can not install a signed addon on version 50.0b2
content: When I try to install an officially signed add-on by dragging and dropping it into the browser, Firefox prompts that the file is corrupted. However, when I directly copy the file to the browser/extensions directory, the browser disables the add-on as untrusted. How can I properly install a signed extension in Firefox version 50.0b2? I can confirm that the extension works correctly when temporarily loaded (via temporary installation), but it fails to install after being officially signed.
creator: zhang.lihuan

title: "importing" my own profile from previous HD
content:
Installed ff on new C drive and trying to import my profile from replaced, working drive. Got as far as pasting previous folder into new one and see new files were added. Both drives W10. But clicking bookmarks and passwords gets "nothing saved." Cannot decipher folder contents, & without details it's a dead end.

Likewise there is a page here on "importing bookmarks from another browser", with a link. It opens to window where you can look for the file. Same problem, not knowing where bookmarks are. Is there a place to find details on what profile folders and files store. Or am I missing something else? Thanks for assist. -- PS Images could be added if any purpose.

title: Lagging sound on video
content:
Good day

I have Firefox 137.0.1 (aarch64 ) running on my Raspberry pi 5 ( 8G Memory ) ( Ubuntu). I have been using this Desktop-settup for 2 years now without problems and all of a sudden, I get a lag on my sound when watching a video. And I do recall observing that an automatic update was done during the past few days.

So I can only assume that the update is to blame for this. Has anyone else noticed something?

I tried searching for a way to report this problem to the developers but I have not found anything.

Perhaps the community can suggest a way for me to pass this to the developers ?

Thank you very much in advance.
creator: johnwslongland

title: Textboxes broken on Canvas
content:
I am a student and often use Canvas to do assignments. Lately when I am trying to open a textbox on Canvas on either a discussion board or on an assignment I get sent to a page that says something broke on discussion boards or the textbox is simply not there on assignments.

I have cleared my browser cache and it did not fix the issue so I instead tried another browser and it works normally over there. I am really not sure what the issue is so any help would be appreciated!

title: None of my links work on my Firefox browser, they keep "trying" to connect but never do (after days...)
content:
I use Pocket on my MacBook Air 2017 MACOS Monterey 12.7.6, and used it daily for years. I cannot access Pocket just now so cannot give you any data about its version. Below is a screenshot of the Firefox version that I just loaded yesterday but which is also refusing to load any link, incl. Pocket. No error message now; yesterday when Firefox refused to load anything, a message saying "Not Secure" showed up atop my screen left of the link I was attempting; it showed up for every link I tried, but is no longer showing up at all, though Firefox continues to be unable to load any link. Second screenshot below is my current attempt to load 2 links plus Pocket, a video of it would show all 3 loading attempts on the screenshot having the little dot moving back and forth side-to-side but never loading. Hope this helps! And thank you kindly for assisting me, Alasdair Coyne

title: Youtube Picture In Picture mode resets video location when scrolling down and logged into specific account
content:
Can't use YT picture in picture mode on Firefox when logged into my YT account. When I enable picture in picture on a video and scroll down to the comments, picture in picture mode turns off as soon as I scroll past the bottom of the video.

Happens only when I'm logged into my YT account on Firefox. Logout, it works. Logged in on Edge, it works. Logged into my second YT account on Firefox, it works. Only doesn't work for this one account.

Attached images if that helps. Last image shows exactly when picture in picture mode turns off when I'm scrolling

title: Tab Crash - As of today, ALL addons are causing a crash
content:
As of today, when I launch firefox, all of my tabs (which have been working fine for the last several days) crash.

https://i.imgur.com/7vrmvam.png

By disabling all of my addons, I get this to go away - and by testing addons one at a time I am able to determine that: -Ublock Origin -Kaskpersky Password Manager Cause all of my tabs to crash.

Whereas: -Sponsorblock for Youtube -Youtube Nonstop Both crash if I visit youtube, but don't affect the browser otherwise.

So it seems like ALL addons are currently broken when they try to affect a tab?
